ChunkText: opt: post-graduation work authorization students who plan on working in a paid position after completing their program must receive work authorization. OPT optional practical training is a type of work permission available for f-1 international students who finish their program requirements. OPT is approved by u.s. citizen and immigration services uscis, with support from the university isss office.
ContextAfter: students who are approved for OPT can work 1 year in unpaidpaid positions after completing their major program of study. read this first OPT follows federal and school regulations: OPT must be related to the students major program of study. students must receive an OPT I-20 from the isss office before submitting their application to uscis.
